alert.note: Alert for Coosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 06 at 5:22PM CDT until August 06 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN ELMORE...TALLAPOOSA AND EASTERN COOSA COUNTIES... At 522 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Goodwater to near Western Lake Martin to Dexter, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Alexander City, Tallassee, Dadeville, Goodwater, Camp Hill, Kellyton, Equality, Eclectic, Jacksons` Gap, New Site, Waverly, Martin Dam, Santuck, Reeves Airport, Titus, Ten Cedar Estates, Nixburg, Southern Lake Martin, Dexter and Hillabee Creek. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
